Class Progression

java.lang.Object
  Progression

public class Progression
extends Object

Progression

Creates Chord progressions based on the song's Genre, with varying structure and Chord complexity

Version:
3.0
Author:
Devon Hubert

Constructor Summary
Progression()
          The default constructor, which creates a simple pop progression in the Key of C Major
Progression(Genre genre)
          The constructor that creates chord progressions for each section of the song, based on the given Genre
 
Method Summary
 void changeKey(Key key)
          Changes the key of the current progression, and adjusts its Chords accordingly
 ArrayList<Chord> fillNotes(ArrayList<Chord> chordList)
          Finds and sets the Notes in every Chord in a Progression based on the Chord type and root name of each Chord
 ArrayList<Chord> findChords(ArrayList<String> functionList)
          Finds abstract Chord types based on the given list of functions ("T" for "Tonic", etc.)
 ArrayList<String> findFunctions(ArrayList<String> functionList, int chordNumber)
          Creates a functionList of Chord functions, based on common song patterns and music theory ("T" for "Tonic", "SD" for "Subdominant", "D" for "Dominant", "D7" for Dominant that always resolves up a perfect fourth, and "R" for the result of Dominant resolution up a fourth)
 ArrayList<Chord> getBridgeChords()
           
 int getChordDistance(ArrayList<Note> chordList1, ArrayList<Note> chordList2)
          Calculates the total distance between all corresponding Chord Notes

          Converts a Chord with 3 or 5 notes into a Chord with 4 notes for voice leading
 ArrayList<Chord> makeProgression(Key key, int chordNumber)
          Combines methods from Progression to form a set of Chords
 int randomKey()
          Creates a "random" key, based on the complexity of the given genre
 String toString()
           
 ArrayList<Chord> voiceLead(ArrayList<Chord> chordList)
          Rearranges the notes of each Chord in a progression so that the movement between Notes occurs with maximum efficiency (the least movement)

Constructor Detail

Progression

public Progression()
The default constructor, which creates a simple pop progression in the Key of C Major

Progression

public Progression(Genre genre)
The constructor that creates chord progressions for each section of the song, based on the given Genre

Parameters:
genre - The song's genre (Rock, Pop, Classical, etc.);
Method Detail

changeKey

public void changeKey(Key key)
Changes the key of the current progression, and adjusts its Chords accordingly

Parameters:
key - The destination Key

fillNotes

public ArrayList<Chord> fillNotes(ArrayList<Chord> chordList)
Finds and sets the Notes in every Chord in a Progression based on the Chord type and root name of each Chord

Parameters:
chordList - The ArrayList of Chords to be filled with Notes
Returns:
the filled ArrayList of Chords

findChords

public ArrayList<Chord> findChords(ArrayList<String> functionList)
Finds abstract Chord types based on the given list of functions ("T" for "Tonic", etc.)

Parameters:
functionList - A list of Chord functions to be interpreted
Returns:
an ArrayList of abstract Chords that fit the given functions

findFunctions

public ArrayList<String> findFunctions(ArrayList<String> functionList,
                                       int chordNumber)
Creates a functionList of Chord functions, based on common song patterns and music theory ("T" for "Tonic", "SD" for "Subdominant", "D" for "Dominant", "D7" for Dominant that always resolves up a perfect fourth, and "R" for the result of Dominant resolution up a fourth)

Parameters:
functionList - The empty ArrayList to be filled with function Strings
chordNumber - The number of Chords desired in the functionList
Returns:
the functionList, an ArrayList of Strings representing Chord functions

getBridgeChords

public ArrayList<Chord> getBridgeChords()
Returns:
an ArrayList of all the Chords in the bridge of the current Progression

getChordDistance

public int getChordDistance(ArrayList<Note> chordList1,
                            ArrayList<Note> chordList2)
Calculates the total distance between all corresponding Chord Notes

Parameters:
chordList1 - An ArrayList of Notes that represents the first Chord
chordList2 - An ArrayList of Notes that represents the second Chord
Returns:
the total distance value (int)

getChorusChords

public ArrayList<Chord> getChorusChords()
Returns:
an ArrayList of all the Chords in the chorus of the current Progression

getGenre

public Genre getGenre()
Returns:
the Genre of the current Progression

getKey

public Key getKey()

getPrechorusChords

public ArrayList<Chord> getPrechorusChords()
Returns:
an ArrayList of all the Chords in the pre-chorus of the current Progression

getVerseChords

public ArrayList<Chord> getVerseChords()
Returns:
an ArrayList of all the Chords in the verse of the current Progression

makeFour

public ArrayList<Note> makeFour(ArrayList<Note> notes)
Converts a Chord with 3 or 5 notes into a Chord with 4 notes for voice leading

Parameters:
notes - An ArrayList of Notes that represents the current Chord
Returns:
the adjusted ArrayList of Notes

makeProgression

public ArrayList<Chord> makeProgression(Key key,
                                        int chordNumber)
Combines methods from Progression to form a set of Chords

Parameters:
key - The song's key
chordNumber - The number of Chords in the specified section of the song
Returns:
an analyzed set of Chords

randomKey

public int randomKey()
Creates a "random" key, based on the complexity of the given genre

Returns:
an integer which represents a Key, and can be translated into one

toString

public String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
a String representation of the Progressions of a song, arranged in the order specified by the song's Genre

voiceLead

public ArrayList<Chord> voiceLead(ArrayList<Chord> chordList)
Rearranges the notes of each Chord in a progression so that the movement between Notes occurs with maximum efficiency (the least movement)

Parameters:
chordList - The original ArrayList of Chords that make up the Progression
Returns:
the updated ArrayList of Chords
